reviewText: Carman is excellent as Orlando Leone, a security guard and former boxing champ, who has dreams of helping his community, the troubled kids in it, and leading his small church, which is why everyone calls him "The Preacher." He tangles with the current champion in the hotel where he is employed, and it leads to a "The Saint vs. The Sinner" match. There are numerous sub-plots that surround the match-up, including Orlando meeting his love interest, the mother of a delinquent child who breaks into his car.The boxing footage is the best part of "The Champion."  It's fast and gritty, and well choreographed and filmed, and overall, the direction by Lee Stanley and the acting by the entire cast is above average for a low-budget B movie. Jeremy Williams is impressive as the street thug turned champion Keshon Banks, Patricia Manterola beautiful as Orlando's love Allia, and Michael Nouri as his brother Freddie, whose motives are dark and crooked, and Jay Allen Jones as Orlando's friend Johnny are very good.This TBN production is only peripherally a Christian film, and if you blinked a few times, you might miss the "religious content." It is nevertheless fairly wholesome fare, with the themes of integrity and giving to others, and worth seeing if you like boxing films without having your ears assaulted with foul language (also not to be missed in this category, and a superb film, is "Cinderella Man"). Carman has used many of his talents in this film, in the writing, and the film score, which uses some of his songs, and though "The Champion" may be occasionally a little cheesy and rough around the edges, it's very entertaining, and fine viewing for the entire family.

reviewText: I can't imagine NOT liking anyting that Carman is involved with as far as videos or music.....but this movie IS truly awesome. It is soooooo nice to watch a movie once in a while with class. The movie is well written and well acted. A must see for all Christians and Christian "dabblers." :) Carman is truly a Man Of God and will reach many with his given ability to reach people right where they are. Carman's music caught my ear when I had no interest in Christian music. While I agree with other reviewers, sometimes Christian movies are sleepers...this one is NOT! I pray that the Christian world will continue to produce movies of this magnitude.
Title: N/A

reviewText: There's no question that Carman is one of the great entertainers of our time.  The fact that he's "working for the Kingdom" makes it even better.  His voice is marvelous, his charisma is energizing, and his message is one of the most powerful you'll ever hear.But there's a small part of me that thinks he should leave all of that on the stage and on his website.  That tiny seed was planted after I saw this movie.  There was a LOT of hype surrounding "The Champion" before it came out in theaters, especially on the Trinity Network, but as far as being as good as almost everyone said it would be, I just have to say...uh, no.  As a movie, it falls just short of made-for-TV in quality, with a less-than-basic plot (you see just about everything that happens in this flick coming from a mile away), laughable action scenes, and dialogue that made me want to cringe at times.  ([...] the Hispanic characters didn't even speak proper Spanish!)  As a message, it falls just short of sending one.  If there is a message somewhere in this flick, then what is it?  "Don't get involved with the Mafia in order to achieve your dreams"?  One would think that a movie like this would have a moral or something in it to help one grow spiritually, but I didn't see it at all.  To me, it was like just about any other direct-to-video action-drama cheese that's out there.  There were a couple of moments that'll stick with me, though; the "commercial shoot" was pretty funny (although they could've used ANY other product but that one), and the pre-match conference scene with the champ's "even God wouldn't recognize him" line.  Otherwise, even Carman fans should steer clear of this one.  Carman sends much more positive messages through his music, and far as me, that's what he should stick to.
summary: Y'know, as an actor, he's a wonderful singer.

reviewText: This movie REALLY delivers a TRULY INSPIRING and HEART-WARMING message to parents and children alike. Lee Stanley does a MARVELOUS job directing this FANTASTIC picture. Buy it. You'll LOVE this film packed with HARD-HITTING action, romance, comedy, drama and NAIL-BITING suspense. This movie-PG in my view-is PERFECT for the WHOLE family. The song that plays at the end of the movie is about the will to persevere in the face of trials and tribulations and knowing that there's One on high watching over us; even though most of us may think otherwise.
summary: A Movie  With A Message."The Champion" scores BIG-TIME!!!!

reviewText: At first I liked it, but after watching it over and over, I got very dissapointed in Carman. The story was dragging it's way to the end, and the it just seemed so terriable. I think Carman should just stick to singing instead of acting. The acting was a total loose, and I just couldn't watch any more of it. I respect Carman's way of praising God, but I wish he could have made this movie more exciting than it already is. There was so many secnes I didn't care to watch and so many things I just couldn't get. I just couldn't take it anymore. Next time, if there is one I pray that he will do a better job at making a good story, and doing some serious acting. This one to me was a major flop.

reviewText: "...for a movie that's supposed to be faith-based, it doesn't seem to do a good job of following Jesus' "turn the other cheek" philosophy. That is unless you count the number of cheeks being turned while people are getting bashed on the side of the face." -Lance; Cruciflicks Co-Founder""Carman: The Champion" is one of those movies that tries too hard. The premise it's based on is interesting enough, but the finished product just doesn't live up." -Mary; Cruciflicks Co-FounderFor the rest of our reviews on this and other faith based films, check out cruciflicks.net where "We don't judge people, just the movies they make."

reviewText: For getting such a high-quality flick out of a Christian production company -- woo hoo! \o/Because, even though this movie came highly recommended, I was still very reluctant to watch it (I bought it online & then let it collect dust on the shelf for a few years), so I was pleasantly surprised when I finally sat down to watch it tonight ...And yet another of my preconceived-notion bubbles was burst in the opening scenes, because I kept thinking, "Okay, maybe the story & the acting are going to be passable, but surely the boxing scenes are going to be hokey & fake looking ... "NOT.I was a big fan of the "Rocky" series (yes, it's true; I admit it) & so I thought there was no way that this movie could live up to my high expectations for a boxing film, but it was actually very realistic (& when you watch the behind-the-scenes footage that comes with the DVD, you will discover WHY the fight scenes are so real-looking ... )So, overall, it's a fun, heart-warming movie to watch by yourself, or with the family; the acting & production values are decent & the music is top-notch (OF COURSE it is, considering who did the score! ;)

reviewText: This is the greatest boxing film I've ever seen in my entire seventeen years on the planet Earth. At first, I had my doubts about Carman being an actor. But he's great. I thought that he was even better than Sylvester Stallone in any of the ROCKY films. I also thought that the plot was extremely well crafted than the ROCKY film stories. Rocky, he had no other reason to fight than for his own self-interests. I thought this movie had it right: a former boxing champion forced to return to the ring after ten years because the dream that he's been fighting for is about to be lost. I also liked the Spiritual background of Carman's character, Orlando Leone, Jr. Being a Christian myself, I found this to be a refreshing boxing movie that was more about fighting for a dream than fighting for your own personal ambition. A very worthy film! I recommend this movie to everyone! I think you'll all enjoy it. Grade: A+

reviewText: This movie was good. But in saying that, there were a couple of places that I feel were compromised and it lacked integrity, but other than that, wow! But the reason above is my reason for only 4 stars.Like some Christian movies, I really didn't know what to expect. This was just as good as any boxing movie I've ever seen. It was a great message and I'd recommend it to anybody, including a non-believer. I was inspired by Orlando's faith and dare to stand up to the heat when the odds were against him.
